Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Lee Paulson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony, Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia Dunn County 15CM281 Count 2, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 Polk County 15CF13 Count 4 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Counts 2, 3, 4, 6, 7 and 8 read-in and dismissed.
-Concurrent to Minnesota Sentence.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant is entitled to 92 days credit under 973.155.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Minnesota sentence

$500.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF414.
$134.97 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF414.

-Cooperate with any Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with the Victims.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Derek Lee Paulson appeared from jail. Case called at 9:20 am. There is an agreement. ADA Correll recites amended information and restitution worksheet to the court. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one, five and nine Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count one, five and nine. The remaining counts will be read in and dismissed.  15TR3397, 15TR3398 and 15TR3399 are also dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court orders:  
One count 1
- 2.5 yrs i/c, 2 yr e/s - concurrent to MN sentence
- $268.00 Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge
- Restitution; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with victims
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Eligible for CIP and SAP

Count 5
- 30 Days Jail - concurrent to count #1
- $243.00 Court Costs

Count 9 
- 2 yrs probation w/h - consecutive to count #1
- $243.00 Court Costs

92 Days credit
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-18-2015 09:15 am
